alert.note: Alert for Cheshire (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 21 at 5:50PM EDT until July 21 at 6:45PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM EDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN CHESHIRE COUNTY... At 550 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Troy, or 7 miles west of Jaffrey, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Jaffrey, Swanzey, Peterborough, Dublin, Richmond, Harrisville, Marlborough, Rindge, Fitzwilliam, Troy, Sharon and New Ipswich. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
